name: InterContinental Abu Dhabi

reviews.text: We have just returned home after a 10 night stay at this hotel in two interconnecting rooms with our sons two sons (half -board). Polite and friendly service the moment we arrived from the porters outside and staff on reception desk. Lobby is beautiful, rooms are really clean and spacious- perfect to relax in when the temperatures outside were soaring high during the middle part of the day. It was a pleasure to use the large gym and the kids enjoyed the squash courts and swimming pool. The white sandy beach is just a walk across the marina. The sea water is warm, clean and idyllic. The food at the Selections restaurant was of outstanding quality and variety. The restaurant staff were attentive to our needs. The concierge team were helpful in arranging our sightseeing while in Abu Dhabi. All in all, our stay at this hotel will be a memorable one.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.text: I was in this hotel for a team building with my colleagues.The rooms are very nice,the staff of the restaurant is great,food is excellent you can chose what you want,the pool is excelent and the beach is beautiful.What I did not like it,is that you can not see waves,it is like a lake.On the other side is a huge hotel.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: We had this hotel at a very attractive rate through BA 's sale in May and stayed for one week with two teenage children. We had previous experience of this hotel and others in the region, so we had clear expectations and this warm, well-sized hotel certainly lived up to them. Yes, there are newer, flashier hotels in the city but the Intercon occupies one of the best sites and it is much better on the inside than its exterior suggests. The lobby is classy; the rooms well furnished for all your needs; the restaurants serve attractive,varied food; the facilities from health club to pool to beach (fantastic upgrade on the way) are ideal; and the levels of service are extremely high. The staff really are delightful - unobtrusive and always smiling. Abu Dhabi is well worth an extended stay and this hotel is great value while you are there.
reviews.title: Revisiting an old friend ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived tired and weary on 17th july and were met by smiling genuine staff. we were given an upgrade from club to an extremely nice suite on the 14th floor. The hotel is undergoing extensive changes to the beach and harbour areas but they in no way intrude onto the ability to enjoy the wonderful white sandy beach and pristine waters of the sea. beach towels were plentiful and ice cold bottles of water always available. The hotel is an older style building but with a prime location for the sea, shops and views. our room was always magnificently clean with daily fruit dishes, newspapers, toiletries, chocolates etc. The house keeping was outstanding and the bed and pillows to die for. Selections restaurant was where we ate most meals with a vast array of foods for every taste all perfectly presented. What makes this hotel so magnificent is the staff from the top echelons to the lower levels, all working as a team and genuinely attentive and caring. We were staying for seven days and made ourselves decide to return next year for two weeks hopefully in may. In every respect Abu dhabi is far more relaxed than its neighbour Dubai, and Ramadan had little effect on our holiday with even the truly magnificent grand mosque open for all to see and be guided around. Even during the fasting times meals were discreetly available to non-moslems. All in all this hotel is one that my wife and I felt totally at home in with amazing staff, terrific food, and tremendous accommodation.When everything is completed this hotel will be six star and rightly so.
reviews.title: ramadan no problem

reviews.text: Hotel is located near the Jumeirah Hotel and Emirates Palace. It offers an own beach and a nice pool. Nice large rooms and outstanding room service. There is a free shuttle to one of the major shopping malls in Abu Dhabi.

i was having lunch there at selection with friend, the food, generally should say just ok, maybe i was expectation too high because it is Intercontinental. there were sushi at the buffet, but the roll, rice was dry, doest really taste very good, not much items, and they have 2 small groups coming for lunch, i was waiting one item for a bit long time. the service crew in selection was friendly, one lady chef as well. or maybe its during ramadan.
reviews.title: not about the stay, just the lunch

reviews.text: This is an Intercontinental hotel in a GCC country, which means something rather drastically different from a small boutique hotel in Venice. It is a vast building where staff are extremely professional, rooms well-designed and equipped, the view on the sea completely uninspiring but let's not spoil the fun.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable, professional service

reviews.text: A variety of restaurants (if you're in for belgium food and beer, or sushis and beer, or even finger buffet and beer for that matter), a range of business services, meeting rooms and areas for more informal meetings in the bar area or lobby without compromising the confidentiality of the discussion. Nothing thrilling but an overall very good value for money for this business trip
reviews.title: A Classic Approach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It isn't the newest, shiniest, glitziest hotel on the radar, but it provides a classy, solid upmarket hotel experience. We were originally booked into the Club Level floor, but ended up moving down a few floors as there were only smoking rooms available when we checked in. Our room was large and comfortable...small bar/eating area, comfortable lounge area and a lovely bedroom. Very nicely decorated and overlooked the pool area. The service was excellent and discreet. Daily restocking of fruit, pastries and chocolates, which was a very nice touch and much appreciated. We had daily access to the spectacular Club lounge...breakfast was excellent and had everything you could imagine on offer. Afternoon cocktails and coffee were a highlight. The staff was wonderful. You are spoiled for choice when it comes to dining options...we ate at Chamas,the Brazilian restaurant and the Fish Market, which was EXCELLENT. Great location, excellent service, good food. It is an oasis of calm. I could live there happily.
reviews.title: Be prepared for a nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nothing to look at from the outside but step through the doors and you are in a different world. The decor is amazing, the staff really lovely and everything is pristine. The only downside is that when we booked in November last year it said that all the beach refurbishment would be finished in May, however in June it was nowhere near finished. Around the pool area , although looking a little tired it was very pleasant and as it is on the third floor there was a little breeze. Once the beach area is finished his hotel will be second to none. It is in a central location and very handy for the shopping malls and the Gand Mosque. Abu Dhabi is a lovely city and after spending ten days here we felt really relaxed.
reviews.title: third visit and still going strong

reviews.text: Am giving this hotel 3 stars only because I think it has slipped over the years. It has been operating for a long time and compared to newer similar category hotels in town it needs to revitalise itself.
reviews.title: Great service and rooms but let down by its restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The super Fish Market restaurant was sadly closed for renovation during my stay. The coffee shop restaurant where breakfast and buffet lunches are served is a depressing place with dark decor. The food choices were limited compared to other hotels.
reviews.title: Spent a week here and loved it!

reviews.text: Meanwhile, the rooms remain very comfortable and well maintained.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Wow! What a great hotel and great people.
reviews.title: Would love to come back, given the chance.

reviews.text: I am fortunate enough to be a platinum ambassador and from start to finish I was well and truly looked after.
reviews.title: My first choice in Abu Dhabi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay very pleasant to Abu Dhabi in the Intercontinental hotel. Very welcoming, very smiling staff. Very attractive room with magnificent view since the 16 floor. As it is specific in the Intercontinental hotel, all the members of this hotel chain are always ready to satisfy the slightest of your desires and to help you. Particular mention to the concierge Loana and Raouf. The hotel is well situated. Pleasant swimming pool to the 3rd floor. As we had taken halfboard, the dinner were highly varied, very good : Asian, Italian, Indian theme.... Bravo to the chefs who were ceaselessly renewed. And Golden Palm to the pastry cooks who realized delicious cakes and deserts.
reviews.title: No 19,5/20 but 18/20...

reviews.text: Some details which could be improved and which would increase the quotation of this hotel: think of putting another music to the restaurant. The anthologies were stabbing, even irritating. To think of golf car to go to the beach which is very distant from the hotel. The alteration work of the beach and both swimming pools, which must be realized for two, three months, is far from being finished! I bet that in 2014, it will not be finished! It's a pity, because the hotel would have been able to have 19,5/20...
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Sun, Sand, Friendly staff, great pool, good food- the IC had it all! We were greeted so warmly by all the staff with fresh juice and cold towels. The staff was so hospitable the whole time I was there- which was about 2 weeks. The pool was beautiful. They would bring watermelon while you sat and soaked up the heat and provided cold water in coolers to keep you hydrated. My housekeeper, Ratan, was great. He was very friendly and kept the room spotless. The breakfast buffet was really nice and had a great variety. The beds were comfortable and my room sported a view of the gulf, which was incredible. I did room service a few nights and it was pretty good. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice marina

reviews.text: A hotel is a hotel is a hotel in a city.
reviews.title: Overall appealing hotel - lacked in one main area Restaurant Etiquette!!

reviews.text: But having a city hotel located next to a marina makes it unique.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

description: InterContinental Abu Dhabi is perfectly situated on the beach and less than 10 minutes from bustling downtown and the Abu Dhabi International Exhibition Centre. Heritage Village, the Cultural Foundation and Lulu Island are also close by. For a unique shopping experience, the Gold Souk (market) is a must while the Marina and Abu Dhabi Malls offer more contemporary alternatives. The hotel concierge can arrange a 4x4 desert safari for those looking for adventure."We are currently working on a beach re-development scheduled to start during the second week of April 2012 and due to be finalized by the third quarter of 2013 .Our exciting new project will enhance the facilities in our hotel by uplifting our outdoor areas. We will take every effort to minimize the disruption to our guests who will continue to have full access to the beach and can enjoy a dip in the sea. Guests can also continue to enjoy our outdoor pool located in our main block."
